titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:13-0400

did.unittitle: Linguistic properties of the Caddo language
did.abstract: The collection comprises linguistic recordings of relating to Caddo vocabulary, phrase structure, syntax, adjectives, and sound changes. Also includes interviews and discussion of Caddo traditional songs and customs. Recorded by Lynette Melar at Binger and Gracemont, Oklahoma in September 1993 with consultants Clara Brown, Retha Cousins, and Helen Tate.
did.physdesc: 29 sound tape reels (14 hr., 45 min.) : analog, 7 1/2 ips, full track, mono ; 7 in.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by Lynette Melnar in 1993 (Acc. 1994-320r). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related manuscript materials are available in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This program records a portion of a Caddo language class and includes several unidentified speakers.
